I very much approve of this challenge. Wish I had more free time!

Interesting challenge. The only problem is that electromagnets don't allow transfer of fuels. To do that, you have to have a kerbal insert the winch end point into a winch end receptacle in docked mode - Which then treats the aircarft as one (Same applies to KAS pipes). THAT could cause some fun with aerodynamics.

Still, it's an interesting concept. Docking ports might be the best way to go, though.

2nd Variant:

Almost docked:

Okay, I tried it with stock planes. No crazy inventions, just a docking port in the back. The plane I used as tanker was not extremely stable, it was flying in circles and a bit up and down but could keep in the air for quite a while. But trying to dock to it was insane. I collided with it twice, on second "success" I sent it to the sea. I could have made it, but only by chance.

However, selecting the other plane's docking port as target definitely helps, as similar approach as in docking in space can be used. It's just all ... really, really fast.
What about VTOLs?
But that would make it less fun.
I think it would be easier to use rockets for the "receiver" aircraft so there is no spool up time, it might give you just the extra control you need.
Make use of Multiplayer plugin anyone?

Does that mod work with other mods(KAS)?

I wanted to try this a couple of times with KAS when I first got it but never tried it.

My idea was to have a kerbal on a Command chair attached to the refueling probe. I think this would be both easier and harder then doing it with docking ports Easier in that the Kerbal has some reach so he can connect the port if it isn't exactly lined up. Harder in that you have to switch around more and designing a refueling probe that doesn't flop round with a Kerbal attached will be a challenge.

This seems like a good use for a simple KOS script to keep the uncontrolled plane steady.

And very well done sploden, this is one of those things that is obviously technically possible but also obviously way too hard to actually succeed at. Yet you managed it!

You can use Space guidance to hold a heading and altitude yes but even just SAS should be able to do that for a while. I have never used it in exactly that way but I have used it to Autoland at my base while I switch to a rover in mid flight. I started moving the rover to it well before the autoland program was done.

Admittedly, no fuel was transferred as yet, but the probe/drogue system i've built here is proven to function. The album below shows two attempts, with a successful grapple and docked KAS link established. Even though I had enabled fuel crossfeed in the grapple cfg it still didnt work so oh well. Relevant mods include FAR, DR, KAS, Pwings, Procedural Parts, Coffee Industries, B9, Firespitter, several of InfiniteDice parts and a whole lot more im sure i've forgotten. Craft were hand flown and switched between to maintain, though both were well behaved.
